entities.name: the eye of the snake
entities.description: The eye of the snake is described as looking around at the class for a few seconds before tearing flesh from the dead cow with its pointed fangs. (Excerpt: 'It looked around at the class for a few seconds, swishing its long black tail...')

entities.name: hagrid
entities.description: Hagrid is described as knowing about the creatures and is present in the scene. (Excerpt: 'He looked eagerly at Ron, but Ron was still staring around into the trees...')

entities.name: ron
entities.description: Ron is described as being confused and nervously expectant, and is unable to see the creatures. (Excerpt: 'He looked eagerly at Ron, but Ron was still staring around into the trees...')

entities.name: the class
entities.description: The class is described as being confused and nervously expectant, and are unable to see the creatures. (Excerpt: 'Most of the rest of the class were wearing expressions as confused and nervously expectant...')

entities.name: the horse
entities.description: The horse is described as standing feet from them and eating. (Excerpt: 'There were only two other people who seemed to be able to see them: a stringy Slytherin boy...')

entities.name: the dead cow
entities.description: The dead cow is described as being eaten by the snake. (Excerpt: 'It looked around at the class for a few seconds, swishing its long black tail, then bowed its head and began to tear flesh from the dead cow...')

entities.name: neville
entities.description: Neville is described as being able to see the creatures and is watching the snake's progress. (Excerpt: 'There were only two other people who seemed to be able to see them...')

entities.name: goyle
entities.description: Goyle is described as being present in the scene and standing behind Neville. (Excerpt: 'a stringy Slytherin boy standing just behind Goyle was watching the horse eating...')

relationships.description: Hagrid is described as knowing about the creatures, and is present in the scene. (Excerpt: 'He looked eagerly at Ron, but Ron was still staring around into the trees...')
Ron looks to Hagrid for guidance and is eager to see him. (Excerpt: 'He looked eagerly at Ron, but Ron was still staring around into the trees...')
Neville is described as being able to see the creatures and is watching the snake's progress. (Excerpt: 'There were only two other people who seemed to be able to see them...')
Goyle is described as watching the horse eating. (Excerpt: 'a stringy Slytherin boy standing just behind Goyle was watching the horse eating...')
Harry is described as seeing proof that the creatures are real. (Excerpt: 'A great wave of relief broke over Harry...')
